Class Details



[line 29]

Converts a document into tokens

Can convert any string into tokens. The base class only supports  identifier/whitespace tokens. For more tokens, the class can be  easily extended.
Use like:  
  1.  <?php
    2. 

  2.   $a = new Tokenizer_Base('hello word');
    3. 

  3.   while ($a->next() !== $a::TOK_NULL) {
    4. 

  4.     echo $a->token, ': ',$a->getTokenString(), "<br>\n";
    5. 

  5.   }
    6. 

  6.  ?>
    7. 






Tags:





  

    internal:  The tokenizer works with a character map that connects a certain  character to a certain function/token. This class is build with speed in mind.
  










[ Top ]







Class Variables



	
	

	
$char_map = array()

	
[line 148]

  Automaticly built character map. Built using $identifiers, $whitespace and $custom_char_map





Tags:





  

    internal:  Public for faster access!
  

  

    access:  private
  






  

	

  

    

      Type:  
      array
    

      

	



	
[ Top ]


	
	

	
$custom_char_map = array()

	
[line 140]

  All characters that should be mapped to a token/function that cannot be considered as whitespace or identifier





Tags:





  

    see:  Tokenizer_Base::unmapChar()
  

  

    see:  Tokenizer_Base::mapChar()
  

  

    internal:  Variable is public + asscociated array for faster access!
  

  

    internal:  array('a' => self::TOK_A) will set token to TOK_A if it matches the character 'a'
  

  

    internal:  array('a' => 'parse_a') will call $this->parse_a() if it matches the character 'a'
  

  

    access:  private
  






  

	

  

    

      Type:  
      array
    

      

	



	
[ Top ]

$identifiers =  'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ01234567890_'

	
[line 128]

  List with all the character that can be considered as identifier





Tags:





  

    see:  Tokenizer_Base::setIdentifiers()
  

  

    see:  Tokenizer_Base::getIdentifiers()
  

  

    internal:  Result token will be self::TOK_IDENTIFIER;
  

  

    internal:  Variable is public + asscociated array for faster access!
  

  

    internal:  array('a' => true) will recognize 'a' as identifer
  

  

    internal:  String will be converted to array in constructor

$whitespace =  " \t\n\r\0\x0B"

	
[line 115]

  List with all the character that can be considered as whitespace





Tags:





  

    see:  Tokenizer_Base::setWhitespace()
  

  

    see:  Tokenizer_Base::getWhitespace()
  

  

    internal:  Result token will be self::TOK_WHITESPACE;
  

  

    internal:  Variable is public + asscociated array for faster access!
  

  

    internal:  array(' ' => true) will recognize space (' ') as whitespace
  

  

    internal:  String will be converted to array in constructor
  

  

    access:  private
  






  

	

  

    

      Type:  
      array|string

method buildCharMap [line 327]

	

    

    

		void buildCharMap(
)
    

    


	
		Builds the $map_char array





Tags:





  

    internal:  Builds single array that maps all characters. Gets called if $whitespace, $identifiers or $custom_char_map get modified
  

  

    access:  protected

method expect [line 531]

	

    

    

		bool expect(
string|int
$token, [bool|int
$do_next = true], [bool|int
$try_next = false], [bool|int
$next_on_match = 1])
    

    


	
		Expect a specific token or character. Adds error if token doesn't match.





Tags:





  

    access:  protected
  









	
        
Parameters:

    

    

          

        string|int  
        $token  
        Character or token to expect
      

          

        bool|int  
        $do_next  
        Go to next character before evaluating. 1 for next char, true to ignore whitespace
      

          

        bool|int  
        $try_next  
        Try next character if current doesn't match. 1 for next char, true to ignore whitespace
      

          

        bool|int  
        $next_on_match  
        Go to next character after evaluating. 1 for next char, true to ignore whitespace
      

        

    


        
[ Top ]

method mapChar [line 308]

	

    

    

		void mapChar(
string
$char, int|string
$map)
    

    


	
		Maps a custom character to a token/function

Used like: mapChar('a', self::TOK_IDENTIFIER) or mapChar('a', 'parse_identifier');





Tags:





  

    see:  Tokenizer_Base::unmapChar()
  









	
        
Parameters:

    

    

          

        string  
        $char  
        Character that should be mapped. If set, it will be overriden
      

          

        int|string  
        $map  
        If function name, then $this->function will be called, otherwise token is set to $map
      

        

    


        
[ Top ]

Class Constants



	
	

	
TOK_IDENTIFIER =  3

	
[line 46]

  Identifier token, used with identifiers


  

	
[ Top ]


	
	

	
TOK_NULL =  0

	
[line 34]

  NULL Token, used at end of document (parsing should stop after this token)


  

	
[ Top ]


	
	

	
TOK_UNKNOWN =  1

	
[line 38]

  Unknown token, used at unidentified character


  

	
[ Top ]


	
	

	
TOK_WHITESPACE =  2

	
[line 42]

  Whitespace token, used with whitespace
